__instruction__: Update values for the keys labeled as 'Required' below. Optional parameters can be left empty.
Exclusive means only one of the ensuing options must be used.
__comment__: (Required) Input folder and file name or for processing multiple files, the pattern of file names.
(Optional) Prefix for the output file name.
(Optional and exclusive) Enter either sheet index OR sheet names, NOT BOTH. The default is the first sheet in the Excel file.
(Optional and exclusive) Enter either the row number (> 0) from which to extract column headers/labels OR custom_column_names_to_assign.
(Optional and exclusive) Enter column names OR indexes (NOT BOTH) to transform/process. If the list is empty, the program will default to using all columns.
(Optional) If you want to change column names, enter the mappings below. If the dictionary is empty, the program will default to original column names.
(Optional) CSV encoding and delimiters. If empty, the program uses Pandas defaults (UTF-8 and comma).
(Optional) Specify which row index (starting from 0) the data begins.
Usually the data begins at row index=1 (row index=0 is for column headers), so we make the default as '1' below.
(Optional) For CSV files, Maximum number of rows to read, process and output in each program iteration (to not overload computer memory).
If below field is deleted, we use 1,500,000 rows as default value, which is defined in transform_utils.py.
(Optional) Specify how many rows we should ignore at the bottom of the data file.
functions_to_apply_to_rows: Like if column 1 is null, ignore row
